thread.title: High school roundup: Scotia earns spot in boys' soccer Foothills finale
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Scotia earns spot in boys' soccer Foothills finale - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Scotia earns spot in boys' soccer Foothills finale
text:
The Scotia boys' soccer team secured the Foothills Council Southern Division title with a 2-1 win over host Broadalbin-Perth on Thursday.
Scotia, which will meet South Glens Falls for the overall league title on Saturday, moved to 14-1 overall and 12-1 in Foothills play. Broadalbin-Perth dropped to 10-3-1 and 8-3-1 in the league.
David McKenzie and Jason Crandall scored in the first half to provide the Tartans a 2-0 lead.
Will Austin got the Patriots on the board with 17 minutes remaining in the game.
Girls' soccer: Voorheesville improved to 14-1 on the season with a 5-0 Colonial Council win over Lansingburgh. Veda Hensel recorded a hat trick and Julia Voss added a goal and three assists. ... Burnt Hills clinched the Suburban Council Gray Division with a 2-1 win over Mohonasen. Alyssa Hughes and Aerin DiCruttalo each scored a goal and Anna Scott made 10 saves to lead the Spartans. Burnt Hills held advantages in shots (20-15) and corners (5-1).
Girls' volleyball: Josselyn Roosenburg had 11 aces and Jacque Fitzgerald added nine aces to lead Loudonville Christian (11-2, 10-1) to a 25-15, 25-15, 25-16 Central Hudson Valley League win over Germantown. ... Shannon Ryan had 16 kills and six digs to lead Columbia over Bethlehem, 27-25, 25-13, 25-13, in a Suburban Council match. Selena Lott added nine kills, four aces and seven digs and Justine Torre had nine kills and three aces for the Blue Devils (12-2). ... Bailey Kross had 19 digs, eight kills and Makayla Shear added 31 assists and nine digs as Ravena (14-1) topped Fonda, 25-14, 25-17, 25-21, in Colonial Council play. Miranda Nethaway led Fonda (12-3) with 11 kills and three blocks and Hanna Moore chipped in 18 assists. ... Camille Novak had nine kills to lead Schenectady over Albany, 25-17, 25-19, 25-21, in Suburban action. Ivory Moore led the Falcons with 16 digs.
Boys' volleyball: Nick Mazone had five aces and Duncan Homer added 18 assists to spark Bethlehem (12-0) to a 25-9, 25-6, 25-22 Suburban Council win over Columbia.
Girls' tennis: Shaker cruised past Emma Willard 9-0 in the Class AA quarterfinals behind Haejin Lee, Mia Fallati, Kyra Fuleihan, Keanna Cruz and Maya Zhou , who all won their singles matches in straight sets. ... Shenendehowa moved onto the Class AA semifinals with a 7-2 win over Guilderland. Paige Ratsep and Sydney Quinn didn't drop a game. ... Morgan Schrader , Brittany Katz and Sallie Suski won in straight sets to lead Burnt Hills over Albany Academy , 7-0, in the Class A semifinals. The Spartans will play Averill Park for the title.
